subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(Object, Object)
msgSnippet: ... That s essentially correct.  The assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2) does not directly call assertTrue(), but it does delegate to o1.equals(o2). Could you
messageBody:
Alexander Zynevich wrote:

>it seems to me that these methods does not test transitivity of equals, which is declared in Java Specification. I think documentation should state that assertEquals(p1,p2) is completely equiv to assertTrue(p1.equals(p2))
>am i right?
>

That's essentially correct. The assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2) does
not directly call assertTrue(), but it does delegate to o1.equals(o2).

Could you explain more about what you feel is lacking here?

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
